reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 7-11 July Junior suite number 214
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, close to perfect!

reviews.text: FREE WIFI
reviews.title: Dont tell your friends!

reviews.text: Loved this hotel! Its interior design is great as well as the looks from the outside. A wonderful terrace to enjoy a drink or have a meal. Bar and restaurant really cool. Our attic room was good size, comfortable with a very smart décor. Nice bathroom with a large shower and separate WC. Good amenities. A relaxing loft style seating area. No view to talk about, since only ceiling windows, thus not much natural light. Had a very nice dinner, an excellent breakfast and many happy cocktails in the hotel. Yes, it’s a training school for hotel personal and sometimes the inexperience shines through, but the friendliness, willingness and politeness makes up for all the shortcomings. The location: It's a good 30 minutes walk to Dam Square which supposedly is the center of Amsterdam. However, it’s close to so many interesting sights. Like 5 minutes walk to Rikjsmuseum. There are also many excellent restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Slight difficulties with parking, although hotel has a garage across the street (for a fee). The hotel has no dedicated area where to stop the car (or taxi) to unload or load your luggage. No bellman. There are certainly many service issues that can be improved upon, but it is a great place where to relax. enjoy and visit Amsterdam.
reviews.title: I will never use facilities of this hotel again !!

reviews.text: Please travellers out there keep this one a secret for yourselves and the closest to you. A beautiful hotel in every sense of the word. They must have spent a fortune renovatiing what seems to be an old school building. As i walked in through the mass of huge brick arches i was amazed at the attention to detail. The room was elegant and interesting set over split levels and there were nice touches like complimentary cookies bought to you before bed time. i love all that stuff! staff were very helpful nothing too much trouble. The bar at night was buzzing with a really cool crowd of fasion type people of mixed ages, ideal when youre getting on a bit. College you really have got the formula for chic boutique bang on and you will definitely be seeing me again. Thank for a great night in a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but didn't love the location

reviews.text: The restaurant at the hotel looks very stylish and cozy, perfectly adapted for a romantic dinner and as well as corporative meeting. I tried to make a reservation for a large group. After 4 e-mails and 6 phone calls I give up.I contacted persona responsible for banquets, but she never responded to my reservation request. She was constantly unavailable, never call back. The front office service was unhelpfully showing a lack of interest. I am working in the tourist business and never experience such a approach towards client that’s want spend time and money at the hotel. What a shame. I will never use facilities of this hotel again !!
reviews.title: Nice atmosphere, interesting design, friendly kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take sunglasses - the rooms are WHITE. Totally white! The beds are comfortable, rooms have air-conditioning ( and if you're at the front, facing the bars over the road, you'll not be opening the windows..... ) and the bathrooms are immaculate - although the shower with no cubicle or curtain might not be to everyone's taste.
reviews.title: Weird, but rather wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is superb; I'd like to have spoken French but the receptin staff were keen to try out their English. The breakfast - in a schoolroom! - is terrific with the best orange juice I've EVER had, anywhere, and as wel as a lovely terrace for relaxing on the 2nd floor, every floor has a fridge stacked with soft drinks and water which are freely available.
reviews.title: Great Value in Lyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent - you're right in the heart of Vieux-Lyon. If you want parking, book it in advance - but if you've more than a Nissan Micra, prepare to sweat. All in all, a lot of fun and very good value.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved this stylish boutique hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I left on vacation, I had read about the College Hotel on TripAdvisor but did not book it because I wasn't sure what day I would arrive in Lyon. When I arrived in they city, I walked into the hotel and was able to get a room. All they had left were their more deluxe rooms and I believe the extra money is worth it. We got a glimpse of the other rooms which may explain some of the reviews stating the accomodations were small. For a few more euros, you can get a large corner room with plenty of storage.
reviews.title: Stay a few days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the great nightlife in the area, we could not find parking and the hotel garage was full. The night desk manager allowed us to park directly in front of the hotel (no parking area) and vowed to watch it the entire night to ensure we weren't towed. In the morning he had even moved the car into the garage for us when a spot came free....what fabulous service...a true life saver! The hotel location is fantastic for seeing Lyon. It is walking distance to all attractions and there is a vibrant pub/bar/gellateria scene at night (though not too noisy). The rooms are air conditioned with flat screen TVs and there is a computer with free internet access in the lobby. There is also a fridge on each floor stocked with pop, juice and multiple types of water that are free for all guests! This hotel isn't cheap but it is truly great value in a city like Lyon.
reviews.title: stickie fingers at College Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We agree with nearly all of the reviews written thus far. The hotel is a great find and -- for a city in France -- quite a bargain. No, it's not cheap, but try to find this sort of value for the money in Lyon and you'll look for a long, long time.
reviews.title: Great find, great location, extremely clean and comfortable

reviews.text: The rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable. At first, we were put off by the lack of shower, but found the tub with "telephone" shower quite manageable.
reviews.title: "No Room at the Inn"

reviews.text: The breakfasts were good and -- we think -- a good value for the money compared to the rest of our trip in France.
reviews.title: Loved the College Hotel

likes.liked: — Funkiness of the hotel, location... location... location, great wireless high speed

reviews.text: Also, free computer access and we nearly always found the lobby computer available for our use.
reviews.title: really cool hotel

reviews.text: The staff were very cordial and helpful. Our only complaint was that they are incredibly bad at giving directions -- their directions (to other sites/landmarks) were always incorrect!! So, be careful.
reviews.title: Fabulous find!

likes.liked: — position and value for money, plus decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay in the College Hotel while we visited Lyon. We were there early in the new year so the town was still quiet and a lot of things were closed but we still had a lovely time.
reviews.title: Worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are lovely and go out of their way to help you. There is a bar next door that they own and we were offered a tasting plate should we go and buy a drink (which we did and it was great). The rooms are on the smallish size but then you don't really spend all that much time in your room. The bathroom was good and the bed was firm. The satellite tv was all in french so don't expect to see the standard CNN. Breakfast was good and fresh, normally we would try local patiseries but as they were all shut we opted to eat in. I can imagine that the street may be busy and loud in summer but we didn't experience it on our visit. Parking is avaliable if you book in advance but be warned it is tight to get into. I'd definately visit should we return to Lyon.
reviews.title: Street noise makes this otherwise lovely hotel totally untenable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So much about the hotel is pleasant and charming that I regret giving it a low rating because of street noise, which makes it impossible to sleep without ear plugs. The square on which the hotel is located (Place Saint Paul) is a major magnet for Lyonnais youth, who pour from surrounding schools in late afternoon, congregate outside the various bars and restaurants on the square, and get louder as evening and night wear on. The three nights we were there recently were very chilly and one was rainy, but neither cold nor wet dampened the rowdy festivities (singing, chanting, screaming), so I can imagine the problem would be far worse in fairer weather. Our first night was before a holiday (Armistice Day) and the raucousness lasted until past 3:00 a.m. The next two nights, it lasted until 2:00 a.m. or so. The hotel's thin windows do little to insulate against the noise. The staff was largely solicitous, but the morning we departed, the elevator was on the fritz and there was no offer to help with our luggage, which we had to lug down seven flights on a very narrow staircase. We were only admonished to not make any fuss about the problem.
reviews.title: Well Located in Vieux Lyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the College Hotel for two nights in August 2009 as part of an Inter-Rail trip through Belgium, Luxembourg and France. We booked directly with the hotel as we found this to be the most cost effective way.
reviews.title: First time in lyon

reviews.text: This hotel is good but for what you get it seemed to be pretty pricey. In saying that, Lyon is France’s second city so no doubt prices are steep across the board. Our room was clinically white, but we knew this before we booked so it’s not a complaint. It was also small and sparsely furnished, despite us booking a large ‘3rd stage’ or ‘post graduate’ room. The smaller, cheaper rooms must be TINY! The bathroom was fairly basic but served the purpose. The room was clean and we did have an excellent view out over the city to our left and up to Notre Dame Cathedral and the TV tower to our right.
reviews.title: Five star staff, comfortable room, great breakfast!!

reviews.text: Outstanding overall experience. Service was top-notch. Amazing bathroom and extraordinary comfort. They even brought water and night snack each evening. Parking on the side street of building if you time it right - No need to pay on Sundays. It's right next to the Metro stop and less than a mile to major museums. If the price is right for you, there is no better place to stay. Simply relaxing in a crazy and active city.
reviews.title: The best hotel we have stayed at in Europe to date!

reviews.text: Breakfast too expensive for a family of four but I'm sure it is awesome.
reviews.title: great choice for amsterdam. will definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fantastic hotel, and atmosphere. the staff is very helpful although not very experienced in it seems for some of them... but the services is really great. the rooms are spacious enough with very high ceilings and a very cosy and modern decor. definitely one of the best hotels in amsterdam, if not the best. the garden is lovely for a lunch or drink and the breakfast is amazing with some of the best french croissant i have ever eaten (and i am french!!)
reviews.title: Great Hotel - but you must have patience!

reviews.text: If one of your biggest pet peeves whilst traveling is the hotel staff and direction not being 100% attentive and customer service oriented, then stay away from this hotel.
reviews.title: Cozy hotel and great location

reviews.text: The College Hotel is run by young "adults" in the midst of studying and training for Hotel Management. While this is truly a great idea, it can cause a bit of annoyance if you don't have the tolerance for such things.
reviews.title: Inferior viewless room mitigated by excellent dinner

reviews.text: Amsterdam is one of my favourite cities...so full of live and special people..and so is this hotel just special. At first glance it just doesen't look like a hotel more like a college as its name says... but if you sneak a peek inside it's just perfect and elegant. The rooms are stylisch and aesthetic. And a little snack awaits you in your room everyday when you come home bushed from your trips through Amsterdam. Stuff is helpful and friendly. And oh I have to say it again the rooms are so absolutely wonderful you look forward to come "home" after a long day full of adventures. Perfect!
reviews.title: What a wonderful place

reviews.text: PS: Try the breakfast :)
reviews.title: You have to be a grownup to stay at this hotel ...............

reviews.text: .............. because it is run by children. You will need patience, plenty of time to wait around, tolerance and the ability to give clear instructions; as there is no initiative from the staff.
reviews.title: Trendy, overpriced hotel - too dark and uncomfortable

reviews.text: Yes I do get the concept and was aware when the hotel was booked - but clearly did not understand the implications. So, the College Hotel is staffed by students and trainees - but they just can't do it. Sure the things you might expect: clunky slow check in while everyone looks on anxiously (can't find booking etc), coming to turn the room down hearing 'come in' rather than 'coming' and entering the room inappropriately.
reviews.title: Trendy Hotel in Beautiful Old Building

reviews.text: But trying to explain at breakfast what an egg white was, waiting 10 minutes for them and then them being inedible (still not sure how). Room service food was not quite as offered in the menu and there was no salt & pepper or spoon to eat the sorbet (I ordered ice cream!). Room servicephone line was out of order when I tried it and front desk not always answered. I asked the location of the in room safety deposit - they were kind enough to explain to me what a safety deposit box looked like. However it was only after I searched to the point of questioning my sanity, that they conceded there are one or two rooms that don't have one. But it is not just the front of house staff and food & beverage team that are the issue. Housekeeping threw away my personal belongings (no where near the bin I can assure you) a packaging sample - which I suppose to the untrained eye did look like an empty bottle - but they also took away a full one too!
reviews.title: Very poor STAFF and Management, Good Hotel, Average Price

reviews.text: The Hotel on its own is really trendy and they have done a great job of refurbishing an old building, and giving the interiors a lot of depth with lighting effects. but at the same time the hotel is a little too dark for comfort - especially if you are out for business and need a working desk with proper lights. the hotel staff is helpful, the service is decent.
reviews.title: Trendy hotel, far from city center, a little too dark!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: but if you want to walk to the city center then it will take you a while and you would need to know how to read your maps quite well!
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon hotel - cool - sexy - gorgeous

reviews.text: I can't speak highly enough about the college hotel - it is so sexy - dark sultry colours and fantastic decor and furnishings. The staff are partly students of the local hospitality schools trained by the regular staff of the hotel but don't be put off this just means that they're really keen and the place is very very well staffed we barely had to wait for anything at all. The bed was very comfortable the room was a little bit smaller than I would have liked but this was the only negative thing you could say because the rest was fabulous. The bathroom was stunning - the bath was so deep and the shower was great, everything was super clean. The restaraunt food is divine and the cocktails in the bar are gorgeous, like everything else in Amsterdam the food and drink is expensive but the quality is superb. The hotel is located in the museum district so a little bit out of town but there is tram stop right outside so that wasn't a problem at all in fact it was nice in the evening to get away from the busy city and the museum district is very pretty. My husband and I both loved it and would recommend it to anyone and everyone even if you are in Amsterdam on a budget trip drop in to them for a cocktail one night because the bar is brilliant.
reviews.title: Trendy design, but not for business travellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights this week having been persuaded to change from my normal hotel (the Pulitzer) by a colleague who raved about the College Hotel.
reviews.title: Luxurious, hip, cosy, want to go back!

reviews.text: First impression on coming into the hotel was that the building has been refurbished very stylishly and with attention to detail however it seemed quite dark coming in off the street (a theme that will recur) and it took me a little while to work out where to go to find the reception area (there were no obvious signs). On approaching the reception the girl behind the desk seemed quite unsure of herself but was quickly joined by a more experienced colleague who guided her through the check-in process which was pretty painless. Wasn't asked any questions about room preferences or similar. The inexperienced receptionist then accompanied me to my room, offering to take my bag but I suspect she wouldn't have been able to carry it as it was a little heavy! My room was on the first floor and on leaving the lift I was told it was quite a long walk so was a bit surprised to find that the room was within about 10m of the lift!
reviews.title: Extremely cosy hotel with spontaneous, efficient service
